abstract: Health insurance advocates in Oklahoma are making last push to enroll uninsured before end of Affordable Care Act's third annual open enrollment, despite strong resistance in state that is one of most opposed to health law; nearly 600,000 Oklahoma residents are uninsured.
lead_paragraph: Supporters of the law regularly encounter stony skepticism in the state: “Obamacare is toxic,” said Craig W. Jones of the Oklahoma Hospital Association.

headline.main: Oklahoma Resists Push for Enrollment in Affordable Care Act Coverage
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Resists a Push for Enrollment in Affordable Care Act Coverage

snippet: Supporters of the law regularly encounter stony skepticism in the state: “Obamacare is toxic,” said Craig W. Jones of the Oklahoma Hospital Association.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
